raw_comment:
Thanks to all students who responded.  We had so many great catchy headlines that capture the main ideas of the graphs:  “Sports:  Diversity or Lies on Head Coaches of Color? The Color Spectrum in Sports” by Rosa of Los Angeles, “Behind the screen. Is it really diverse in the front office?” by Liam, Chen, and Alex and “The Colour of Sports” by Madison and Kai, both of Winnipeg, Manitoba, Canada, “The Roles People of Color Hold in Sports Leagues” by Lauren of Academy of Saint Elizabeth in Morristown, New Jersey, and “The Divide in Diversity: The Gap Between Diverse Athletes and Coaches” by OBBI of Eden Prairie High School, Minnesota.
 
You can continue to post responses.  Please check back by Friday, Feb. 5 to see the Reveal with a link to the original New York Times article, some questions about the map, and a few Stat Nuggets.
 
Please visit our archive to see all graphs in this series (tinyurl.com/NYTGraphs).
View our archives that link to all past releases, organized by topic (tinyurl.com/NYTGraphsTopicIndex), 
graph type (tinyurl.com/NYTGraphsTypeIndex) and 
Stat Nugget (tinyurl.com/NYTGraphsStatNuggetsIndex). 
 
Signing off – Sharon Hessney of Boston, who thinks progress in diversifying professional sports has been too little too slowly, and Corey Andreasen, grade 5 mathematics teacher at the American School of the Hague, the Netherlands, who thinks the patters we see in these graphs is an indication of a much wider problem.
